intro: Lutzia globosa, commonly known as the globular lutzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense clusters of small, showy flowers. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and have a rough texture. Lutzia globosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
